required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase II Study of Fruquintinib in Combination With Gefitinib in Patients With Advanced Non-small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Fruquintinib in Combination With Gefitinib as First-line Therapy in Patients With Advanced Non-squamous Non-small-cell Lung Cancer Harboring Activating EGFR Mutations : a Single-arm, Multicenter, Phase II Study

brief_summary.textblock: Fruquintinib in combination with Gefitinib as first-line therapy in patients with advanced non-squamous non-small-cell lung cancer harboring activating EGFR mutations : a single-arm, multicenter, phase II study

detailed_description.textblock: This phase II trial will evaluate the combination of fruquintinib and gefitinib in advanced NSCLC. The endpoint will be to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the combination.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed until study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Occurrence of completed response or partial response after treatment, assessed by RECIST 1.1

primary_outcome.time_frame: Each patient will be followed for 30 days after the last dose
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.03

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed until study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The duration from first dose to first documented progression or death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed by RECIST 1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed until study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of completed response, or partial response, or stable disease, assessed by RECIST 1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed until study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: the period from the date of first dose to the date when the criteria for complete response or partial response was first measured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed until study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Duration from first documented completed response or partial response to first documented progression or death from any cause, whichever came first

intervention.description: Fruquintinib will be administered orally once daily from Day 1 to Day 21 per 28-day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity
Gefitinib will be administered orally once daily per 28-day cycle or unacceptable toxicity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed Informed Consent Form.
- Age between 18 to 75 years old.
- Histologically or cytological documented stage IIIB/IV non-squamous non-small cell lung cancer patients who have never received systematic treatment for the late-stage disease.
- ECOG 0-1
- Patients must have measurable lesions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior systematic treatment for the advanced NSCLC
- Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) < 1.5×10^9 /L, or platelet count < 100 ×10^9/L, or hemoglobin < 9 g/dL
- Total bilirubin > 1 ULN; SGOT (AST), SGPT (ALT), > 1.5 ULN; for patient with liver metastasis，AST or ALT > 3 ULN
- Known HIV positive
- Hypersensitivity to either of the investigation drugs

facility.name: The First Hospital of Zhejiang University
